passage_text: Mylanta is the brand name of an over-the-counter (OTC) drug used to treat heartburn and upset stomach. Mylanta belongs to group of drugs known as antacids, which neutralize stomach acid. The medication contains a combination of aluminum hydroxide and magnesium hydroxide.

Noun. 1. Mylanta-an antacid. trademark-a formally registered symbol identifying the manufacturer or distributor of a product. alkaliser, alkalizer, antacid, antiacid, gastric antacid-an agent that counteracts or neutralizes acidity (especially in the stomach). 1  Facebook.
Indications for MYLANTA: Acid indigestion, sour stomach, heartburn, upset stomach. 10–20mL between meals and at bedtime or as needed; max 90mL/day (Supreme), 120mL/day (Reg str), 60mL/day (Max str).

Mylanta products that also relieve painful gas, such as Mylanta Regular Strength, contain simethicone. You can also buy a generic form of aluminum hydroxide and magnesium hydroxide, the antacid ingredients in Mylanta. There are versions of Mylanta that contain other ingredients.
